{"step_by_step_thinking": "The first step in the management of a woman with bilateral tubal block seen at the cornu on hysterosalpingogram is to evaluate the extent and severity of the tubal blockage. This can be done through further diagnostic tests such as laparoscopy and hysteroscopy. These procedures can provide a direct visualization of the fallopian tubes and the uterine cavity, allowing for a more accurate assessment of the tubal blockage. Based on the findings from these procedures, the appropriate treatment option can be determined. In this case, since the tubal blockage is bilateral, tuboplasty may be a suitable treatment option to restore tubal patency. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Tuboplasty.", "answer_choice": "D"}
